thoughts on the matter of marketed identities this specifically addressed at the 'networking' profile websites where one makes lists of lists and then lists of those lists, everything kept as much on the surface as possible. mana for the masses, the privileged masses that is. thoughts related: 1. the marketing of identity is equal to the objectification going on in a magazine like playboy and in terms of meaning and potential to change the world is rather similar. 2. you can get so caught up in this creation of identity (which you believe is true) that you lose whatever you had in the first place. 3. the wish to have an identity to feel clear about it, it's human nature, to take it to an extreme, that erases human nature, and erases the possibility of conversation is what i think of as marketing one's identity. 4. it is about supply and demand (in terms of identity), it says something about world-order. 5. fabrication is easier than thought. 6. reappearance of "irony" as a way to make fun of anyone who has less, is less in terms of world order. i find it heavily disturbing in terms of collective psychology (which i am not a huge fan of to begin with), or as a cultural phenomenon; a definite/ limitted structure which creates nothing and is equal to manually killing braincells while rejecting absolutely any kind of meaning/ action/ creation. the fact that someone can reject any form of meaning and action not just in their own lives but in the lives of others, that is a PROBLEM when the world is going in the direction that it is.

to add a few more words. too much loudness coming in from the street. i can clearly hear someone's phone conversation which i would assume he would want to keep private. but he is making it impossible on himself. gone... but i had meant to return to my previous thought the marketing of one's own identity. let me of course add that the majority of the world does not have this luxury, but i will focus on the westerners just now. why do we make it so easy to get boxed in? the fight for freedom is replaced by the fight to have a "cooler" profile. we take the pre-made categories, the pre-made products, the pre-made words and only choose from those to define ourselves. rebellion has been replaced by appropriation of various serious issues in order to make fun of them. when nothing is taken seriously anymore, when meaning is lost, is the world really going in the right direction?
we market and sell ourselves with no outside help. i can't help but feel angst and anger when i see the way identity has become a commodity, a luxury for those who are in power roles.

is fear. the arrogance of others is a great point of anger for me. could i tear my arrogance apart though? i definitely must say that arrogance is borne from reactions to what one receives from the outside. i don't really see it as inherent in human nature. i see it as inherent only when it is stirred. for example if one kicks a rock it might fall, but the rock could very easily sit there forever otherwise and never fall. arrogance is much like that for me. it is a shield, but sometimes the shield turns into a sword, and attacks others that i find it intolerable. but why does one need a shield to begin with? because its all about competition. because even when you think you are outside the system you are still competing within it. survival in the current system is based on competition, it is not based on owning up to one's weaknesses, it is about destroying someone else whether it be through directly exploiting/pointing out their weaknesses or whether it might be through exaggerating one's strengths and uniqueness. the feeling must constantly be there that there is someone above and someone below. the alternative cannot be born from a vertical line with a beginning and an end, it must come from infinitely many horizontal planes, with no end and no beginning.

for a woman artist to make a painting of a sexualized woman for it to be filled with meaning? for it to actually become a political, empowered object? is it really enough just for that to happen? i can't think so. i can't feel so when it is all product, product after product. women create products just as much men do, even using themselves as the object.

in my search for somewhat inspiring texts i went to the bookstore. there was an ambulance and 2 police cars outside, people watching through the window and all attention of those in the bookstore focusing on one area. i stepped in, soon after a young man had attempted suicide. the situation seemed complicated (apart from the attempted suicide which seemed to be a call for attention since they held him in the store for about 30 minutes so the emergency couldn't've been that great). from what i gathered from all the whispers he had shop-lifted something, the police had been called, then he had slashed his wrists. at first i didn't know about the attempted suicide, the man was standing up, he was hand cuffed. some minutes later when i looked again he was sitting on an ambulance chair type thing and they were patching up his bleeding wrists, i could see the blood. i kept on looking for some books fruitlessly, aimlessly, but gave up eventually. i heard some screaming that he didn't want to go to jail, but i left the bookstore, i didn't want to wait around. i didn't know how to feel in the face of this very personal, impersonal act. i was cold towards the situation. eventually i went in search of a specific kind of chocolate cake which was nowhere to be found. i returned to the bookstore about 20 minutes later, this time they were all getting ready to leave, the man was in the ambulance, door was open, he seemed sedated, i couldn't look him in the eye, not that i should've expected otherwise. i feel numb, as i was in the bookstore an older man told me "don't do what that guy did!"(or something to that extent) i'm not sure what i should interpret that as, but i found it a rather odd, misplaced statement from a stranger. and the day goes on

to keep on coming out, though i suppose on a day like today it is all as a release, certainly more thoughts will follow, more questions, but today this is just my space, the space inside of me reflected on this screen in these words. i'm trying to think of a way to lead my life that won't cause me so much damage, that won't include so much sabotage, senseless, self-destructive sabotage. not an easy plan to come up with. i just want to overhaul.

i stand on the edge, like those rocks on the edge of the sea, or of the land, depending on how one looks at it. so i guess i stand in the middle, on the edge of 2 things, but not on the outside. it's funny how one can stand in the middle and feel entirely on the edge, and maybe the feeling isn't so bad if one learns to accept it within, to love it within. maybe things can't always be the way we are taught to wish they should be. in fact i have already learned that lesson from experience, but it seems i have yet to come to terms with it in my behavior.

like water and sand between my fingers. this summer i miss the black sea, i feel like that is where i should be, but am not and am sad and helpless in face of the distance. i can't help it, obviously but it still saddens me. where are all the magical answers hiding? there are few rocks to search beneath, but maybe under sidewalks, and skyscrapers, maybe behind the neon signs. i won't give up searching, somehow i know they are out there and that gives me an extra breath.

i do not know where to begin my thoughts in here, and there are always so many of them. 1. intimidation/fear/gender. every time i think of gender i take a deep breath, i inhale and then exhale and then wonder why it is that i have such reactionary feelings about it, why i feel the need to first strike back and think only afterwards. what is it that i cannot accept? i cannot accept the roles that are pre-assigned that even the questioners don't question. there are so many ways of defining gender, one's gender, inherent physical/biological definitions, societal ones and then i suppose somewhere in the mix another section. and i identify, but i do not. i have never questioned whether i identified, i always knew i did, but i have always questioned with what and do i have a choice? do people look at me the same way i look at them? we'd be in trouble then. without accepting my gender (on a general level) i cannot accept myself, a constant battle, no ending in sight, a discomfort that can take one over at any moment, a rash action that is harder to take back.

the reactions i have to groups, to ideological impositions, to myself. partly it is a question of a group, of feeling constantly on the outside of a group so that groups have negative connotations and have had them for ages. i'm not even sure if it is within me to be inside a group, or if i would be happy if i was inside. i can no longer tell if this is because of me and who i am or if it is because what i have become through experience, i suppose a mixture of the two. i am a reactionary person, no doubts. i have a lot of anger, a lot of aggression inside and i do not want to blame myself for it, but instead prefer to analyze to see its strengths and weaknesses and of course eliminate the flaws in my thinking and my way of being and reacting.

the tight schedule... wednesday is missing once again. i suppose it is different when i have allotted myself the time away, but i dislike missing a day in my writing ritual. it is supposed to be an exercise, and exercises are meant to be structured, but somehow i react even to my own structure, i dislike all structure and at the same time yearn for it in a way or another, trying to impose it on myself, trying to find it outside of me so i can enter it ready-made.

feel guilty about who i am and who i admire in life. i don't want to feel guilty for feeling anger, or for understanding anger and extremes. sometimes i wonder if i should be ashamed, or what that will resolve. will that take me further in the direction i want to go? will that change me in a positive way? is it shameful not to fit even my own idea of perfection, because i do not fit it. i cannot fit when i read the words i read and feel understanding. such a vail cover these words, right now i am not ready to lift it. and with the words above i suppose i must forcefully end the vacation i had imposed on myself.
